args: Is this article primarily about a new action or announcement by the Trump administration/White House/Executive? Respond simply with "yes" or "no" . Trump: Government will sell $5 million ‘gold card’ to wealthy immigrants President Donald Trump said on Tuesday that the United States will soon sell a $5 million “gold card” to give foreign nationals “green card privileges” and a “route to citizenship.” Trump made the announcement during an executive order signing in the Oval Office, telling reporters, “Wealthy people will be coming into our country by buying this card.” “They’ll be spending a lot of money and paying a lot of taxes and employing a lot of people, and we think it’s going to be extremely successful,” Trump said, claiming that the program — which he said will begin in about two weeks under his executive authority and without the approval of Congress — is “totally legal.” Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick told reporters in the Oval Office that the Trump administration will be ending the controversial EB-5 investor visa — sometimes referred to by critics as the “golden visa.” The citizenship pathway created in 1990 requires significant investments in a new business that would create full-time jobs in the United States. Lutnick said the $5 million requirement for the “gold card” would be paid “to the U.S. government” and applicants would require “thorough vetting.” Lutnick suggested the money would be used “to reduce our deficit,” but Trump would not definitively state whether that money would be earmarked specifically for deficit reduction. The president said that if “gold card” holders create jobs within the United States, “they’ll pay full taxes like everybody else.” Trump also said he anticipated that the card would be used by American companies seeking to bring in talent from abroad. When asked whether Russian oligarchs would be eligible for a “gold card,” Trump responded, “Yeah, possibly. I know some Russian oligarchs that are very nice people.”
